intro: Clerodendrum ternatum f. villosum, commonly known as the silky Clerodendrum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The silky texture of its leaves distinguishes this variety from other forms of Clerodendrum.
